Inventions & Discoveries.name: Echoes of Innovation
Inventions & Discoveries.description: Delve into the fascinating world of groundbreaking inventions and pivotal discoveries. This quiz explores the origins of technologies and explorations that shaped our world, from early sound recordings to daring expeditions.

questions.text: The first sound recording to be made and reproduced was a recitation of what nursery rhyme?
questions.hint: This rhyme features a girl and her pet, often sung to a simple melody.

questions.text: What is the name of the Newtonian law that states 'An object in Motion tends to stay in motion'?
questions.hint: This law is the first of Newton’s three laws of motion.

questions.text: What was the name of the first nuclear-powered submarine?
questions.hint: This submarine shares its name with a fictional vessel from a Jules Verne novel.

questions.text: What was the name of the first ship to sail around the world?
questions.hint: This ship was part of Ferdinand Magellan’s expedition, named after a Spanish queen.

questions.text: In 1909, Frederick Cook claimed to be the first explorer to reach what location?
questions.hint: This icy destination is one of the Earth's geographic extremes.

questions.text: Ada Lovelace is credited with being the first person to have made what?
questions.hint: Her work with Charles Babbage involved early concepts of computing.

questions.text: The first commercial radio station was located in what city?
questions.hint: This city is in Pennsylvania, known for its steel industry and rivers.

questions.text: Modern computer microchips are primarily composed of what element?
questions.hint: This element is abundant in sand and central to the semiconductor industry.

Inventions & Discoveries.description: Test your knowledge of the brilliant minds and revolutionary moments that propelled human progress. This quiz covers a range of inventions and discoveries, highlighting the individuals who dared to innovate.
